intro: Echites sylvestris, commonly known as the wild echites, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a rough texture. Echites sylvestris is often found in moist, shaded environments and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
